intro: Ponapea palauensis, commonly known as the Palau starling, is a flowering plant native to the island of Palau in the western Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal forests and rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
